definition: Measurement of the force of blood against arterial walls expressed as systolic over diastolic.
example_usage: BP is 120/80 mmHg within normal limits.

definition: Number of heartbeats per minute.
Number of breaths taken per minute.
Measurement of body heat typically in Fahrenheit or Celsius.
Gas essential for cellular respiration often measured as saturation level.
example_usage: Patient on 2L O2 via nasal cannula.

definition: Percentage of hemoglobin saturated with oxygen measured by pulse oximetry.
Basic body measurements including BP HR RR temperature and sometimes oxygen saturation.
Traditional set of three vital signs measured together.
Measurement and recording of all fluids entering and leaving the body.
example_usage: Monitor strict I&O for renal patient.

definition: Calculation using height and weight to assess body composition.
Calculated measurement of total body surface used for medication dosing.
example_usage: Chemotherapy dose calculated based on BSA.

definition: Laboratory test measuring red cells white cells hemoglobin hematocrit and platelets.
Laboratory test measuring glucose calcium sodium potassium CO2 chloride BUN and creatinine.
example_usage: BMP reveals hyperglycemia and elevated creatinine.

definition: Extended metabolic panel including BMP plus liver function tests and protein levels.
Blood test measuring clotting time used to monitor warfarin therapy.
Blood test measuring clotting time used to monitor heparin therapy.
Standardized measure of blood clotting time primarily for warfarin monitoring.
example_usage: INR therapeutic range is 2-3 for AFib.

definition: Hormone test used to assess thyroid function.
Active thyroid hormone test.
example_usage: Free T3 level within normal range.

definition: Thyroid hormone test.
example_usage: Free T4 low in hypothyroid patient.

definition: Blood test measuring average glucose levels over 2-3 months used for diabetes management.
example_usage: HbA1c of 6.8% indicates fair diabetes control.

definition: Blood test measuring oxygen carbon dioxide and pH from arterial blood.
Laboratory examination of urine for infection protein blood and other abnormalities.
example_usage: UA positive for bacteria and WBCs.

definition: Panel of tests measuring liver enzymes and bilirubin to assess liver health.
Imaging using X-rays from multiple angles to create cross-sectional images.
example_usage: CT scan of abdomen ordered to rule out appendicitis.

definition: Imaging using magnetic fields and radio waves to create detailed body images.
example_usage: MRI of brain shows no acute findings.

definition: Imaging using electromagnetic radiation to visualize internal structures especially bones.
example_usage: Chest X-ray reveals pneumonia in right lower lobe.

definition: Imaging using sound waves to visualize soft tissues and organs.
Nuclear imaging showing metabolic activity used for cancer and neurological conditions.
example_usage: PET scan indicates metabolically active lesions.

definition: Test recording electrical activity of the heart.
Test recording electrical activity of the heart.
Ultrasound of the heart to assess structure and function.
Difficulty breathing or feeling unable to get enough air.
example_usage: Patient presents with SOB and chest pain.

definition: Discomfort or pain in the chest area.
example_usage: Patient c/o severe CP radiating to left arm.

definition: Feeling of sickness with urge to vomit and actual expulsion of stomach contents.
Assessment of consciousness and awareness to person place time and situation.
example_usage: Patient A&O x4 with no deficits.

definition: Degree of awareness and responsiveness.
Indicating test results or findings are in the normal range.
Patient appears comfortable without signs of immediate medical crisis.
example_usage: Patient in NAD resting comfortably in bed.

definition: Notation indicating patient-reported symptoms or concerns.
Tube inserted through nose into stomach for feeding or drainage.
example_usage: NG tube placed for gastric decompression.

definition: Indwelling urinary catheter inserted through urethra into bladder.
example_usage: Foley catheter inserted for strict output monitoring.

definition: IV catheter inserted in arm vein and threaded to central vein near heart.
example_usage: PICC line placed for long-term antibiotics.

definition: Large IV catheter inserted into major vein for medications fluids and monitoring.
example_usage: CVC placed in internal jugular for pressors.

definition: Catheter inserted into artery for continuous blood pressure monitoring and blood sampling.
Tube inserted through mouth or nose into trachea to maintain airway and provide ventilation.
Supraglottic airway device used as alternative to intubation.
Non-invasive ventilation providing two levels of air pressure.
example_usage: Patient on BiPAP overnight for sleep apnea.

definition: Non-invasive ventilation providing constant air pressure to keep airways open.
Pain management system allowing patient to self-administer preset doses of pain medication.
example_usage: PCA pump set with morphine for post-op pain.

definition: Extent of movement possible at a joint.
example_usage: Physical therapy working on shoulder ROM.

definition: Basic self-care tasks including bathing dressing eating and toileting.
Patient has no documented allergies to medications.
Patient has no documented allergies to any substances.
Common antiplatelet medication used for pain fever inflammation and cardiovascular protection.
example_usage: Patient takes daily ASA 81mg for cardiac prophylaxis.

definition: Class of medications (ACE inhibitors) used to treat hypertension and heart failure.
example_usage: Started on ACE inhibitor for blood pressure control.

definition: Class of antibiotics used to treat bacterial infections.
example_usage: Patient allergic to PCN - documented in chart.

definition: Medication frequency indicating dosing every other day.
example_usage: Medication taken QOD for maintenance therapy.

definition: Medication frequency indicating dosing once per week.
Medication frequency indicating dosing once per month.
Medication timing at bedtime.
example_usage: Sleep aid taken HS as needed.

definition: Medication timing in the morning hours.
example_usage: Thyroid medication taken AM on empty stomach.

definition: Medication timing in the evening hours.
example_usage: Statin taken PM to maximize effectiveness.

definition: Unit of medication measurement equal to one-thousandth of a gram.
Unit of medication measurement equal to one-millionth of a gram.
Unit of liquid volume equal to one-thousandth of a liter.
Unit of liquid medication measurement.
Solid oral medication form.
Medication enclosed in gelatin shell.
Shortness of breath that occurs with physical activity.
example_usage: Patient reports DOE with climbing stairs.

definition: Sudden shortness of breath at night that awakens patient.
Visible bulging of neck veins indicating elevated central venous pressure.
Pressure in central veins measured via CVC reflecting fluid status.
Average blood pressure during one cardiac cycle.
example_usage: MAP maintained above 65 for adequate perfusion.

full_form: Pupils Equal Round Reactive to Light and Accommodation
definition: Standard eye examination notation indicating normal pupil function.
Standardized assessment of consciousness based on eye verbal and motor responses.
example_usage: GCS score of 15 indicates full consciousness.

full_form: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale
definition: Standardized assessment tool to measure stroke severity.
Medication taken only when necessary rather than on a schedule.
Emergency response to cardiac or respiratory arrest.
example_usage: Called Code Blue for unresponsive patient.

definition: Team activated for patients showing concerning decline before full arrest.
example_usage: Called Rapid Response for change in mental status.

definition: Surgical procedure to repair fractured bones using hardware.
example_usage: Patient scheduled for ORIF of left femur.

definition: Surgical procedure replacing damaged hip joint with prosthetic.
Surgical procedure replacing damaged knee joint with prosthetic.
Open heart surgery creating new routes around blocked coronary arteries.
example_usage: Patient stable post CABG x3 vessels.

definition: Minimally invasive procedure to open blocked coronary arteries using catheter and stent.
example_usage: PCI performed with drug-eluting stent placement.

definition: Procedure using endoscope to diagnose and treat bile duct and pancreatic conditions.
Endoscopic examination of esophagus stomach and first part of small intestine.
Endoscopic examination of the entire colon and rectum.
Procedure using scope to visualize airways and obtain tissue samples.
example_usage: Bronchoscopy with biopsy for pulmonary nodule.

definition: Procedure inserting needle into spinal canal to collect cerebrospinal fluid.
example_usage: LP performed to rule out meningitis.

definition: Procedure removing fluid from pleural space around lungs.
Procedure removing fluid from peritoneal cavity in abdomen.
Medical term for stroke caused by interruption of blood flow to brain.
Temporary blockage of blood flow to brain with symptoms resolving within 24 hours.
Chronic condition where stomach acid flows back into esophagus.
Sores in stomach or duodenal lining.
Progressive loss of kidney function over time.
Sudden loss of kidney function.
Blood clot in pulmonary artery blocking blood flow to lungs.
Life-threatening response to infection causing organ dysfunction.
example_usage: Patient in septic shock requiring pressors.

definition: Life-threatening complication of diabetes with high blood sugar and ketones.
example_usage: Admitted for DKA with glucose over 400.

definition: Severe lung condition causing fluid buildup and breathing failure.
Condition where heart cannot pump blood effectively causing fluid buildup.
example_usage: CHF exacerbation with lower extremity edema.

definition: Irregular heart rhythm in the atria increasing stroke risk.
example_usage: AFib with RVR requiring rate control.

definition: Life-threatening heart rhythm with no effective pumping.
Rapid heart rhythm originating in ventricles.
Rapid heart rhythm originating above ventricles.
